column1: Only available with the "Logged URLs" addon. Please contact us to order.
column2: Only available with the "Logged URLs" addon. Please contact us to order.

column1: Adding a new queued job will delete any existing queued jobs.
column2: Adding a new queued job will delete any existing queued jobs.

column1: Almost always enable this. There is no reason to crawl a product that has been disabled.
column2: Almost always enable this. There is no reason to crawl a product that has been disabled.

column1: Are you sure you want to change the status?
column2: Are you sure you want to change the status?

column1: Changing the lock key is unsupported
column2: Changing the lock key is unsupported

column1: Currencies that are disabled when generating URLs. CTRL-Click to select more thanone
column2: Currencies that are disabled when generating URLs. CTRL-Click to select more thanone

column1: Did you know more pages will be crawled if logged URLs is enabled?
column2: Did you know more pages will be crawled if logged URLs is enabled?

column1: Enable generating URLs from the core rewrite table
column2: Enable generating URLs from the core rewrite table

column1: Enable or disable reading URLs from a directory
column2: Enable or disable reading URLs from a directory

column1: Enable or disable the verbose log. Be careful, this can create a large log file.
column2: Enable or disable the verbose log. Be careful, this can create a large log file.

column1: Enable or disabling destroying session after each crawl request.
column2: Enable or disabling destroying session after each crawl request.

column1: Exclude disabled products from being crawled
column2: Exclude disabled products from being crawled

column1: Exclude hidden products from being crawler
column2: Exclude hidden products from being crawler

column1: Flush magento cache prior to the crawl
column2: Flush magento cache prior to the crawl

column1: Flush the cache prior to the crawl. Usually should be disabled.
column2: Flush the cache prior to the crawl. Usually should be disabled.

column1: Flushing the magento cache ensures all the block caches are refreshed and will ensure crawled URLs are showing the most recent information.
column2: Flushing the magento cache ensures all the block caches are refreshed and will ensure crawled URLs are showing the most recent information.

column1: Generated URLs consist of your products, default category pages (no pagination, no sort by options, etc), and CMS pages.
column2: Generated URLs consist of your products, default category pages (no pagination, no sort by options, etc), and CMS pages.

column1: Hidden products are products that your customers will most likely never see. For example, a simple product that is not visible in the category as it is only used as part of a configurable product.
column2: Hidden products are products that your customers will most likely never see. For example, a simple product that is not visible in the category as it is only used as part of a configurable product.

column1: If disabled then an already cached page will not be refreshed with a new version, which can dramatically increase crawl speed. Note: this only works with Extendware Full Page Cache
column2: If disabled then an already cached page will not be refreshed with a new version, which can dramatically increase crawl speed. Note: this only works with Extendware Full Page Cache

column1: Job must be defined before working directory can be determined
column2: Job must be defined before working directory can be determined

column1: Logged URLs are every page in your site that a visitor has been to. Logged URLs are read from the Extendware Full Page Cache extension. If you are using another Full Page Cache Extension, then no logged URLs will be crawled unless they create a compatible log file for our crawler.
column2: Logged URLs are every page in your site that a visitor has been to. Logged URLs are read from the Extendware Full Page Cache extension. If you are using another Full Page Cache Extension, then no logged URLs will be crawled unless they create a compatible log file for our crawler.

column1: Max time to wait for a request to complete. Setting too low could cause increased server load.
column2: Max time to wait for a request to complete. Setting too low could cause increased server load.

column1: No jobs are present in the queue. They will be automatically added by the crawler cronjob. Did you properly setup the crawler specific cronjob according to the crawler installation guide?
column2: No jobs are present in the queue. They will be automatically added by the crawler cronjob. Did you properly setup the crawler specific cronjob according to the crawler installation guide?

column1: Only crawl a URL if it has been logged this number of times. This ensures the crawler does not crawl tens of thousands of pages that no one will ever visit again (such as an uncommon search string). Keep in mind that a URL is only log on cache. So, if your pages expire every 5 days, then the maximum times that page will be logged in a month is around 6.
column2: Only crawl a URL if it has been logged this number of times. This ensures the crawler does not crawl tens of thousands of pages that no one will ever visit again (such as an uncommon search string). Keep in mind that a URL is only log on cache. So, if your pages expire every 5 days, then the maximum times that page will be logged in a month is around 6.

column1: Only currencies will be crawled that are enabled for the store. If you wish to disable a currency that is enabled for the store, you may do so here. If you have a large site and use multiple currencies that are infrequently used by your visitors, then this disabling this currency here will make the crawl much more efficient.
column2: Only currencies will be crawled that are enabled for the store. If you wish to disable a currency that is enabled for the store, you may do so here. If you have a large site and use multiple currencies that are infrequently used by your visitors, then this disabling this currency here will make the crawl much more efficient.

column1: Please <u>read the help descriptions, field descriptions, fieldset descriptions, and user guides</u> so you may configure this extension to suit your needs.
column2: Please <u>read the help descriptions, field descriptions, fieldset descriptions, and user guides</u> so you may configure this extension to suit your needs.

column1: Please select an item(s) before submitting to the mass processor
column2: Please select an item(s) before submitting to the mass processor

column1: Raising this value too high will slow down your server. You can change this to determine the optimal value and then set it permanently in the crawler config.
column2: Raising this value too high will slow down your server. You can change this to determine the optimal value and then set it permanently in the crawler config.

column1: Selected item(s) (%d) have been mass processed by the %s processor
column2: Selected item(s) (%d) have been mass processed by the %s processor

column1: Selected item(s) (%d) have failed to be mass processed by the %s processor
column2: Selected item(s) (%d) have failed to be mass processed by the %s processor

column1: Selected item(s) (%d) have failed to be mass processed by the %s processor (running jobs with an enabled status cannot be deleted)
column2: Selected item(s) (%d) have failed to be mass processed by the %s processor (running jobs with an enabled status cannot be deleted)

column1: Some data such as crawler state, num crawled urls, etc can take several minutes to update
column2: Some data such as crawler state, num crawled urls, etc can take several minutes to update

column1: Some settings such as status and max threads can take several minutes to take effect
column2: Some settings such as status and max threads can take several minutes to take effect

column1: The average number of URLs crawled per minute over the entire crawl
column2: The average number of URLs crawled per minute over the entire crawl

column1: The higher the number the faster the crawls, in general. Keep in mind, 2 threads is 2 concurrent requests, 3 is 3 concurrent requests, etc. If you set this to a higher number than your server can handle, then your store will become very slow.
column2: The higher the number the faster the crawls, in general. Keep in mind, 2 threads is 2 concurrent requests, 3 is 3 concurrent requests, etc. If you set this to a higher number than your server can handle, then your store will become very slow.

column1: The higher this number the more likely the crawler will crawl old / expired URLs. Set this to a value that lets the crawler build history, but is not so long that old, invalid URLs can never be "forgotten".
column2: The higher this number the more likely the crawler will crawl old / expired URLs. Set this to a value that lets the crawler build history, but is not so long that old, invalid URLs can never be "forgotten".

column1: The main thing this can be used for is if a server has limited resources you can set max threads to one and then add a wait between each request to give the server a break.
column2: The main thing this can be used for is if a server has limited resources you can set max threads to one and then add a wait between each request to give the server a break.

column1: The maximum number of concurrent requests to your Web site at one time. Be careful about setting this too high
column2: The maximum number of concurrent requests to your Web site at one time. Be careful about setting this too high

column1: The minimum number of minutes to wait after the last crawl until a new crawl starts. "0" means a crawl will queue as soon as the last crawl finishes (continuous crawling).
column2: The minimum number of minutes to wait after the last crawl until a new crawl starts. "0" means a crawl will queue as soon as the last crawl finishes (continuous crawling).

column1: The more segments the longer processing will take, but it will use less memory. 2 and 3 segments will be 2 and 3 time slowers than 1 segment, but memory can be dramatically reduced. Maximum: 100
column2: The more segments the longer processing will take, but it will use less memory. 2 and 3 segments will be 2 and 3 time slowers than 1 segment, but memory can be dramatically reduced. Maximum: 100

column1: The name of the main script for your store. Usually this is index.php. This is only used if you have rewrites disabled
column2: The name of the main script for your store. Usually this is index.php. This is only used if you have rewrites disabled

column1: The number of occurrences a url must be in a the log before it is crawled. Usually this should not be set for more than 5.
column2: The number of occurrences a url must be in a the log before it is crawled. Usually this should not be set for more than 5.

column1: The number of parallel requests performed at one time
column2: The number of parallel requests performed at one time

column1: The number of segments used to process the logged urls.
column2: The number of segments used to process the logged urls.

column1: The number of URLs created from logs. It can take a few weeks before this is > 0. Only available if you have the Deep Crawling / Logged Urls addon.
column2: The number of URLs created from logs. It can take a few weeks before this is > 0. Only available if you have the Deep Crawling / Logged Urls addon.

column1: The number of URLs created through generation.
column2: The number of URLs created through generation.

column1: The number of URLs that have been crawled
column2: The number of URLs that have been crawled

column1: The number of URLs that you have added programmatically according to the userguide.
column2: The number of URLs that you have added programmatically according to the userguide.

column1: The relative path to the directory from the mage root that contains the *.log files
column2: The relative path to the directory from the mage root that contains the *.log files

column1: This feature is for if you run Extendware Full Page Cache. Otherwise, you will need to create correctly formatted CSV files to use this feature.
column2: This feature is for if you run Extendware Full Page Cache. Otherwise, you will need to create correctly formatted CSV files to use this feature.

column1: This is recommended to always be on. Each crawl request creates a new session, so without destroying these new sessions your session data will increase by a lot.
column2: This is recommended to always be on. Each crawl request creates a new session, so without destroying these new sessions your session data will increase by a lot.

column1: This log every URL that is crawled to the ewcrawler.log file. Be careful leaving this enabled as it can create a huge log file.
column2: This log every URL that is crawled to the ewcrawler.log file. Be careful leaving this enabled as it can create a huge log file.

column1: This should almost always be disabled. This option is only compatible with the Extendware Full Page Cache. If enabled, then your site will be slow during the crawl as the cache will be empty until the crawler rebuilds it.
column2: This should almost always be disabled. This option is only compatible with the Extendware Full Page Cache. If enabled, then your site will be slow during the crawl as the cache will be empty until the crawler rebuilds it.

column1: This usually does not need to be changed. If your store URLs are like this: http://www.domain.com/scriptname.php/, then you will need to change this to the name of the script.
column2: This usually does not need to be changed. If your store URLs are like this: http://www.domain.com/scriptname.php/, then you will need to change this to the name of the script.

column1: Time in milliseconds to sleep after each request finishes. This should normally be 0. 1 second = 1000 milliseconds
column2: Time in milliseconds to sleep after each request finishes. This should normally be 0. 1 second = 1000 milliseconds

column1: To prevent overloading our demo server crawler jobs will not actually run in the demo and will not be automatically scheduled.
column2: To prevent overloading our demo server crawler jobs will not actually run in the demo and will not be automatically scheduled.

column1: Total number of minutes that the crawl took
column2: Total number of minutes that the crawl took

column1: URLs longer than this number of days will not be included in the crawl
column2: URLs longer than this number of days will not be included in the crawl

column1: When a URL matches one of the above regular expressions it will be excluded from the crawl.
column2: When a URL matches one of the above regular expressions it will be excluded from the crawl.

column1: You should set this to as high of a value as you can tolerate. Crawling does take server resources, so there is no reason to keep crawl very frequently unless your use case requires it.
column2: You should set this to as high of a value as you can tolerate. Crawling does take server resources, so there is no reason to keep crawl very frequently unless your use case requires it.
